meta.title: Ventura Unified School District > School Closures

div.h4: If your student does not remember their Google Password, please follow these directions to retrieve through Q Connect.

div.p: In the interest of the health of our community, the Ventura Unified School District Board of Education and Superintendent have decided to close all VUSD schools beginning Monday, March 16 through Thursday, June 11, 2020. To be clear, the 2019/20 school year is not over. It has transitioned from in-person classroom instruction to distance learning for the rest of this academic year.
This closure includes:

ul.li: and Ventura Adult and Continuing Education (VACE).

div.p: Field Trips/Athletics/Travel, etc.

Beginning Monday, March 16, we are canceling all school district-sponsored events and travel including, field trips, visual and performing arts events, PTA/PTO sponsored events, dances, employee work travel and all athletic events, including practices until further notice. We are canceling all non-VUSD events and activities scheduled to occur on any VUSD property through June 11, 2020.

div.h4: Edgenuity Middle and High School Student Distance Learning
div.p: How Much Time Should My 6-12 Grade Student be Spending on Each Course?

Many families have reached out asking how much time their 6-12 grade students should be spending per class per day. While the answer will vary as each student's current situation looks different during this crisis, we would recommend that you use the following grid to assist in that answer. If your student is struggling to make "progress" within the below timeframe, all teachers can customize the course for individual students to relieve some pressure/stress. We strongly encourage all parents/students to reach out directly to teachers to ask for help.

h2.span: CANVAS- TK-5, 6-12 Electives and CTE Courses

div.h4: Having Difficulty Logging Into Canvas? Watch this video- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lKwGFyM72GQ

h4.b: Canvas/Instructure Students & Parent Guide for 2020 VUSD School Closure

p.b: Students will be using Canvas/Instructure as their primary resource for TK-5, Middle and High School Electives, and Career Education Classes for the 2020 VUSD school closure. Canvas/Instructure is a Learning Management System where students can access their teachers and coursework. You will not be able to access your student’s course until the class is published by the end of the day Monday, April 13, 2020.
Courses will appear on the dashboard
While your student is logged in to Canvas/Instructure, follow these steps: How do I generate a pairing code for an observer as a student?
Once you have a pairing code go to
, click on the top right “Need a Canvas Account? Click Here. It’s Free!”

b.a: How do I sign up for a Canvas account as a parent?
How do I create an account in the Canvas Parent app on my iOS device?
How do I create an account in the Canvas Parent app on my Android device?

div.h4: Devices for students who do not have access at home
div.p: We have completed our large deployment of devices. If you family needs a device or your device is not working please contact the main line for your school. We do have folks answering messages left on those lines and will assist you.
If you do not have internet avaialble to you, please read this document that will provide options. If that does not help please call our Technology Helpline at 805-641-5000 x1450.
div.h4: Device not connecting to your home internet?
div.p: If your VUSD issued Chromebook gives you the warning that you do not have permission from the administrator to add the WiFi, please follow these steps to resolve. We apologize as some of the Chromebooks were not configured properly.

ol.li: Families should go to the parking lot at the nearest VUSD school closest to the main building
Next, look for the VUSDM wireless network.
Upon connection, the parents/students need to log into the student’s Google account.
Stay connected for 2 minutes after logging into Google.
The management policy will be downloaded during this 2 minute time period.
The family should peruse their Google drive to confirm their files.
After 2 minutes, the family can go home and connect to their network.

div.h4: Having Trouble with your VUSD Loaned iPad?
div.p: Please use these directions to assist you in connecting.

Food and Nutrition will continue to provide meals to our students. To minimize the risk to our employees who are on the front lines daily and our families, we will be distributing meals once a week for the rest of the school year.. We will be distributing on Mondays from 11: 30 am- 1 pm at the usual six sites (see below).

1. Atlas Elementary School 760 Jazmin Avenue, Ventura
2. Montalvo Elementary 2050 Grand Avenue, Ventura
3. Will Rogers Elementary 316 Howard Street, Ventura
4. Data Middle School 2060 Cameron Street, Ventura
5. Sheridan Way Elementary 573 Sheridan Way, Ventura
6. Sunset K-8 School 400 Sunset Ave., Oak View

Due to the rise in the number of meals that some families have requested, we now need to limit the number of meals one family can pick up for children ages 1-18. That weekly limit will be five meal packs (breakfast and lunch). We ask that each family only take what they need for the children in their care.
Meals are staple items for both breakfast and lunch and are first-come, first-serve. Please follow the food safety guidelines below:

-Keep refrigerated items refrigerated. Example: milk, string cheese
-Keep frozen items either refrigerated or frozen until heating for consumption. Example: burrito, corn dog
-Heat items fully for consumption.
​-Rinse fresh fruit or produce items before consumption.
-Discard any items that have reached an expiration date.
-Discard any leftovers by end of day Friday.
-Meals items are subject to change due to availability of products

We understand these are challenging times for all of our families. We know that some of our students and their family members may need resources for mental health, emergency information, homeless/financial hardship, food banks, and tutoring services. This Family Resource Document is a list of those that we recommend you reach out to in the event you do need help.

div.div: Message from Superintendent Rice to VUSD Class of 2020
Message from Dr. Roger Rice, Superintendent 03-26-2020

h2.span: Additional Family Activity Packets for Grades PreK-12

p.strong: To support all families during this challenging time amidst the Coronavirus/COVID-19 outbreak, we have compiled a list of resources to engage all students in a fun way during this closure. Please browse the following Family Activity Packets for Grades Prek-12. Please select a packet based on your child's age and/or ability level. Many of these activities have been designed so that they are appropriate for students with disabilities. We have put them in Levels A-E for ease of use. Level A is the least challenging to Level E which is the most challenging. In addition, we are providing downloadable pdfs of the packets currently being distributed at our meal distribution sites. If you would prefer to print them on your own they are below.
Downloadable PDF Packets- not required, just for fun and engagement
